definition: to go far/to escape to faraway places
to distance oneself from (classical)
far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
high/tall/above average/loud/your (honorific)
surname Gao
to fly

sentences.english: July, she will fly, and give no warning to her flight.
sentences.chinese: 七月，她远走高飞，对我不辞而别。

sentences.english: Had it not been for his family, He'd have gone away long ago .
sentences.chinese: 要是没有家眷拖累，他早就远走高飞了。

sentences.english: Redheaded clowns will have all gotten into their tiny cars and driven away, never to return.
sentences.chinese: 红头发的小丑都坐上小车，远走高飞，再也不回来了。

sentences.english: Come away with innocence, and leave me with my sins.
sentences.chinese: 带着清白远走高飞，带着我的罪恶离我远去。

sentences.english: But that hasn’t stopped young lovers from running away together.
sentences.chinese: 但这并不能阻碍现今的年轻恋人们一同远走高飞。

sentences.english: Think only of to seek a direction of divagation, thus I can go far away.
sentences.chinese: 只想找个流浪的方向，这样我就可以远走高飞了。

sentences.english: About what are you still hesitating?
sentences.chinese: 现在我要带你远走高飞。

sentences.english: If one day you want to run way . Don't be afraid to call me .
sentences.chinese: 如果有一天你想远走高飞，别害怕，给我打个电话。
《远走高飞》戏剧化了我们的困境。

sentences.english: All your friends have moved away, anybody who can do it.
sentences.chinese: 只要可以，你的朋友们都远走高飞了。

sentences.english: A girl had a far-reaching aspiration, and she will go farther now, four boys went to see her off.
sentences.chinese: 一位心性高远的女孩要远走高飞了，四个男孩去送她。

sentences.english: When it does, we'll be long gone.
sentences.chinese: 等它找上时，我们早就远走高飞了。

sentences.english: Her mother died when Betty was eight, and that’s when her father took off.
sentences.chinese: 她8岁的时候母亲去世了，接着父亲远走高飞了。

definition: to elope
lit. to rest and fly together (idiom)/fig. to live in each other's pockets/to be inseparable
to roam far and wide (idiom)/to travel the world
to avoid a problem by walking away from it/to quit
to cast away
to throw down/to dump/to abandon/thrown down
to fly high and run far (idiom); to leave in a hurry for a distance place
gone forever
wife and child
(of marriage or business partners) to break up (idiom)/to separate
to flee to avoid an arranged marriage
to have no cares/to be carefree
to conceal one's identity/living incognito
not having anything at all (idiom); utterly lacking/without two sticks to rub together
to be all alone in the world
lit. two segments with a single cut (idiom)/fig. to make a clean break (idiom)
